summary: Millions of Americans buy health insurance from their state marketplaces. Marketplace plans must cover essential health benefits, such as hospital stays. Many people can get a federal tax credit—paid directly to their insurance companies—to offset the part of the premium that pays for these benefits. States may require plans to cover additional benefits, but federal funds can't be used to offset the part of the...
title: Health Insurance Marketplaces: CMS Has Limited Assurance That Premium Tax Credits Exclude Certain State Benefit Costs
